description: [[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[[-jkm44444Replacement of external fire escape staircase and door to the rear of Town Hall (following removal of existing external staircases); repair and restoration of the rear elevation windows, doors and brickwork; and bin store enclosure to rear of building (Deemed Listed Building Consent Application)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.  Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard the architectural and/or historic interest of the building and the Ealing Town Centre Conservation Area, in accordance with policy 4.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and the Ealing Town Centre Conservation Area Management Plan (2007) and policy 7.8 of the London Plan (2011).
